title.value: Analyzing Data Augmentation for Medical Images: A Case Study in Ultrasound Images
title.justification: The title is derived from the provided text and accurately represents the content of the paper.
title.quote: Analyzing Data Augmentation for Medical Images: A Case Study in Ultrasound Images

extractions.description: This paper investigates the effectiveness of various data augmentation techniques for improving the classification of breast lesions in ultrasound images. Using different augmentation strategies, the study assesses their performance across multiple datasets and tasks within medical imaging.

type.justification: The study conducts a series of experiments to evaluate the performance of different data augmentation techniques.
type.quote: The problem needs to be addressed more rigorously and systematically through an experimental approach.

name.justification: The paper focuses on improving medical image classification, particularly in the context of breast ultrasound images.
name.quote: One domain where this is especially true is breast ultrasound images.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is the evaluation and analysis of data augmentation techniques.
name.quote: This work addresses this issue by analyzing the effectiveness of different augmentation techniques for the classification of breast lesions in ultrasound images.

name.justification: The study employs machine learning models and techniques for the classification tasks.
name.quote: fine-tuned the weights of pre-trained ResNet-18 models from the Torchvision library

name.justification: The paper specifically deals with ultrasound images for breast lesion classification.
name.quote: We subsequently applied our methodology to the BUSI and BUS-BRA [14] datasets (both of which are publicly available).

name.justification: ResNet-18 is the model architecture used for the experiments.
name.quote: We fine-tuned the weights of pre-trained ResNet-18 models from the Torchvision library.

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not introduce ResNet-18 but uses an existing architecture.
is_contributed.quote: We fine-tuned the weights of pre-trained ResNet-18 models from the Torchvision library.

is_executed.justification: The ResNet-18 model was executed in the study.
is_executed.quote: We fine-tuned the weights of pre-trained ResNet-18 models from the Torchvision library.

is_compared.justification: The model's performance is compared with various augmentation techniques.
is_compared.quote: We report the average balanced accuracy (bAcc) and change in balanced accuracy (∆ bAcc) along with the unadjusted P values.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific referenced paper for ResNet-18 is mentioned.

name.justification: The BUSI dataset is used for the experiments involving breast lesion classification.
name.quote: the popular Breast Ultrasound Image (BUSI) dataset [3]

name.justification: The BUS-BRA dataset is used for further experiments involving different classification tasks.
name.quote: In contrast, the examples in the BUS-BRA dataset are labeled according to pathology, either malignant (607 images) or benign (1268 images), and by BI-RADS rating [1] (562, 463, 693, and 157 images with BI-RADS ratings of 2, 3, 4, and 5, respectively).
